text: Psalm 95
A Call to Worship and Obey
Come, let us sing for joy to Yahweh;
let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
with songs let us shout joyfully to him.
For Yahweh \add is\add* \add the\add*\f + \fr 95:3 \ft The Hebrew does not have the definite article used twice in the translation of this verse \f* great God,
and \add the\add* great king over all gods,
in whose hand \add are the\add* unexplored places\f + \fr 95:4 \ft Or “the deep places” \f* of \add the\add* earth,
and \add the\add* heights of \add the\add* mountains \add are\add* his,
to whom belongs the sea that he made, \f + \fr 95:5 \ft Hebrew “and he made it” \f*
and \add the\add* dry land \add that\add* his hands formed.
Come in, let us worship and bow down;
let us kneel before Yahweh, our maker.
For he \add is\add* our God,
and we \add are\add* the people of his pasture
and the sheep of his hand.
⸤Today⸥\f + \fr 95:7 \ft Literally “The day” \f* if you will hear his voice:\f + \fr 95:7 \ft Or “If only you would hear his voice today” \f*
“Do not harden your heart as \add at\add* Meribah,
as \add in\add* the day of Massah in the wilderness,
when your ancestors\f + \fr 95:9 \ft Or “fathers” \f* tried me.
They put me to the test,
\add even\add* though they had seen my work.
For forty years I loathed \add that\add* generation,
and said, ‘\add They are\add* a people \add whose\add* heart wanders.
And my ways they do not know.’
Therefore I swore in my anger,
‘They shall surely not enter into my rest.’ ”
